Question: At his death, this person was eulogized as "first in war, first in peace, and first in the hearts of his countrymen" by Henry Lee.
Hints: This person's ancestors were from Sulgrave, England; his great-grandfather, John ****, had emigrated to Virginia in 1657.
This person also joined the Freemasons fraternal association in Fredericksburg at this time.
This person came to oppose slavery on both moral and economic grounds.
